sub_topic: Calculation of the power output of an electrochemical cell
message_1: What is the power output of a lithium-ion battery if the battery has an electrode potential of 3.7 volts and a current flow of 2 amperes?
message_2:
The power output of a lithium-ion battery can be calculated using the formula:

Power (P) = Voltage (V) × Current (I)

Given the electrode potential (voltage) of 3.7 volts and a current flow of 2 amperes:

P = 3.7 V × 2 A

P = 7.4 watts

The power output of the lithium-ion battery is 7.4 watts.
